intro: Solidago chinensis, commonly known as Chinese goldenrod, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and features lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowering heads consist of numerous small disk flowers surrounded by pale yellow to white ray florets. Solidago chinensis is often found in moist soils along stream banks and in woodland edges, where it thrives in partial to full sunlight.
